title: background-color
description: The background-color CSS property sets the background color of an element, either through a color value or the keyword transparent.

title: background-image
description: The CSS background-image property sets one or several background images for an element.

title: background-position
description: The background-position CSS property sets the initial position, relative to the background position layer defined by background-origin for each defined background image.

title: background-repeat
description: The background-repeat CSS property defines how background images are repeated.

title: background-size
description: The background-size CSS property specifies the size of the background images.

title: color
description: The color property sets the foreground color of an element's text content, and its decorations.

title: direction
description: Set the direction CSS property to match the direction of the text: rtl for languages written from right-to-left (like Hebrew or Arabic) text and ltr for other scripts.

title: @font-face
description: The @font-face CSS at-rule allows authors to specify online fonts to display text on their web pages

title: font-family
description: The font-family CSS property lets you specify a prioritized list of font family names and/or generic family names for the selected element.

title: font-size
description: The font-size CSS property specifies the size of the font

title: font-style
description: The font-style CSS property lets you select italic or oblique faces within a font-family.

title: font-variant
description: This property acts as a shorthand for the longhand properties: font-variant-caps, font-variant-numeric, font-variant-alternates, font-variant-ligatures, and font-variant-east-asian.

title: font-weight
description: The font-weight CSS property specifies the weight or boldness of the font.

title: font
description: The font CSS property is either a shorthand property for setting font-style, font-variant, font-weight, font-size, line-height and font-family, or a way to set the element's font to a system font, using specific keywords.

title: letter-spacing
description: The letter-spacing CSS property specifies spacing behavior between text characters.

title: line-height
description: On block level elements, the line-height property specifies the minimum height of line boxes within the element.

title: <link> element in <body>
description: The HTML Link Element (<link>) specifies relationships between the current document and an external resource

title: <link> element in <head>
description: The HTML Link Element (<link>) specifies relationships between the current document and an external resource

title: @media
description: The @media rule is used to define different style rules for different media types/devices.

title: CSS pseudo-class :active
description: The :active CSS pseudo-class matches when an element is being activated by the user. It allows the page to give a feedback that the activation has been detected by the browser

title: CSS pseudo-class :empty
description: The :empty pseudo-class represents any element that has no children at all. Only element nodes and text (including whitespace) are considered. Comments or processing instructions do not affect whether an element is considered empty or not

title: CSS pseudo-class :first-child
description: The :first-child CSS pseudo-class represents any element that is the first child element of its parent.

title: CSS pseudo-class :first-of-type
description: The :first-of-type CSS pseudo-class represents the first sibling of its type in the list of children of its parent element.

title: CSS pseudo-class :focus
description: The :focus CSS pseudo-class is applied when a element has received focus, either from the user selecting it with the use of a keyboard or by activating with the mouse (e.g. a form input).

title: CSS pseudo-class :hover
description: The :hover CSS pseudo-class matches when the user designates an element with a pointing device, but does not necessarily activate it.

title: CSS pseudo-class :last-child
description: The :last-child CSS pseudo-class represents any element that is the last child element of its parent.

title: CSS pseudo-class :last-of-type
description: The :last-of-type CSS pseudo-class represents the last sibling with the given element name in the list of children of its parent element.

title: CSS pseudo-class :link
description: The :link CSS pseudo-class lets you select links inside elements. This will select any link which has not yet been visited, even those already styled using selector with other link-related pseudo-classes like :hover, :active or :visited.

title: CSS pseudo-class :not()
description: The negation CSS pseudo-class, :not(X), is a functional notation taking a simple selector X as an argument. It matches an element that is not represented by the argument. X must not contain another negation selector.

title: CSS pseudo-class :nth-child
description: The :nth-child(an+b) CSS pseudo-class matches an element that has an+b-1 siblings before it in the document tree, for a given positive or zero value for n, and has a parent element. More simply stated, the selector matches a number of child elements whose numeric position in the series of children matches the pattern an+b.

title: CSS pseudo-class :nth-last-child
description: The :nth-last-child CSS pseudo-class matches an element that has an+b-1 siblings after it in the document tree, for a given positive or zero value for n, and has a parent element.

title: CSS pseudo-class :nth-last-of-type
description: The :nth-last-of-type CSS pseudo-class matches an element that has an+b-1 siblings with the same element name after it in the document tree, for a given positive or zero value for n, and has a parent element.

title: CSS pseudo-class :nth-of-type
description: The :nth-of-type CSS pseudo-class matches an element that has an+b-1 siblings with the same element name before it in the document tree, for a given positive or zero value for n, and has a parent element.

title: CSS pseudo-class :target
description: The :target pseudo-class represents the unique element, if any, with an id matching the fragment identifier of the URI of the document..

title: CSS pseudo-class :visited
description: The :visited CSS pseudo-class lets you select only links that have been visited.

title: CSS pseudo-class ::after (:after)
description: The CSS ::after pseudo-element matches a virtual last child of the selected element. It is typically used to add cosmetic content to an element by using the content CSS property.

title: CSS pseudo-element ::before (:before)
description: ::before creates a pseudo-element that is the first child of the element matched. It is often used to add cosmetic content to an element by using the content property.

title: CSS pseudo-element ::first-letter (:first-letter)
description: The ::first-letter CSS pseudo-element selects the first letter of the first line of a block, if it is not preceded by any other content (such as images or inline tables) on its line.

title: CSS pseudo-element ::first-line(:first-line)
description: The ::first-line CSS pseudo-element applies styles only to the first line of an element.

title: CSS adjacent selector
description: This is referred to as an adjacent selector. It will select only the specified element that immediately follows the former specified element.

title: CSS attribute selector [attr^=value]
description: Represents an element with an attribute name of attr and whose value is prefixed by "value".

title: CSS attribute selector [attr~=value]
description: Represents an element with an attribute name of attr whose value is a whitespace-separated list of words, one of which is exactly "value".

title: CSS attribute selector [attr$=value]
description: Represents an element with an attribute name of attr and whose value is suffixed by "value".

title: CSS attribute selector [attr=value]
description: Represents an element with an attribute name of attr and whose value is exactly "value".

title: CSS attribute selector [attr*=value]
description: Represents an element with an attribute name of attr and whose value contains at least one occurrence of string "value" as substring.

title: CSS attribute selector [attr]
description: Represents an element with an attribute name of attr.

title: CSS child selector
description: The > combinator separates two selectors and matches only those elements matched by the second selector that are direct children of elements matched by the first.

title: CSS class selector
description: In an HTML document, CSS class selectors match an element based on the contents of the element's class attribute

title: CSS descendant selector
description: The ␣ combinator (that's meant to represent a space, or more properly one or more whitespace characters) combines two selectors such that the combined selector matches only those elements matching the second selector for which there is an ancestor element matching the first selector. Descendant selectors are similar to child selectors, but they do not require that the relationship between matched elements be strictly parent-child.

title: CSS type selector
description: CSS type selectors match elements by node name

title: CSS id selector
description: In an HTML document, CSS ID selectors match an element based on the contents of that element's ID attribute, which must match exactly the value given in the selector.

title: CSS general sibling selector
description: The ~ combinator separates two selectors and matches the second element only if it is preceded by the first, and both share a common parent.

title: CSS universal selector (asterisk)
description: An Asterisk (*) is the universal selector for CSS. It matches a single element of any type.

title: <style> element in <body>
description: The HTML Style Element (<style>) contains style information for a document, or part of a document.

title: <style> element in <head>
description: The HTML Style Element (<style>) contains style information for a document, or part of a document.

title: text-align
description: The text-align CSS property describes how inline content like text is aligned in its parent block element.

title: text-decoration
description: The text-decoration CSS property is used to set the text formatting to underline, overline, line-through or blink.

title: text-indent
description: The text-indent property specifies how much horizontal space should be left before the beginning of the first line of the text content of an element.

title: text-overflow
description: The text-overflow property determines how overflowed content that is not displayed is signaled to users.

title: text-shadow
description: The text-shadow property adds shadows to text.

title: text-transform
description: The text-transform CSS property specifies how to capitalize an element's text.

title: vertical-align
description: The vertical-align CSS property specifies the vertical alignment of an inline or table-cell box.

title: white-space
description: The white-space property is used to describe how whitespace inside the element is handled.

title: word-spacing
description: The word-spacing property specifies spacing behavior between tags and words.

title: word-wrap
description: The word-wrap property is used to specify whether or not the browser may break lines within words in order to prevent overflow when an otherwise unbreakable string is too long to fit in its containing box.
